text:
Raskolnikov glanced around the tiny room. 

The old woman stood before him, arms crossed. 

“What do you want?” she asked sharply. 

“I’ve brought something to pawn,” he replied, pulling out a silver watch. 

“Time’s up for your last pledge,” she said. 

“I’ll bring the interest for another month. Please wait.” 

“That’s for me to decide,” she shot back. 

“How much for the watch, Alyona Ivanovna?” 

“A rouble and a half. Interest in advance.” 

“A rouble and a half!” he exclaimed, frustration boiling. 

“Take it or leave it,” she said, handing back the watch. 

He clenched it tightly, anger coursing through him.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov attempts to pawn a silver watch but is met with the old woman's harsh refusal and undervaluation of his item.
